intro: Solanum virgatum var. calvescens, commonly known as the common nightshade, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into berries, which are usually red when ripe. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields. Botanically, it is characterized by its solanaceous features, including the presence of alkaloids and a capsule-like fruit structure.
